4395.quoteText:
INDEMNITY

You agree to indemnify and hold Us, and Our subsidiaries, affiliates, officers, agents, co-branders or other partners, and employees, harmless from any alleged claim or demand, including reasonable attorney fees, made by any third party due to or arising out of Your use of the Service, Your connection to the Service, Your violation of the TOS, or Your violation of any rights of another, whether You are a registered user or not. You are solely responsible for Your actions when using the Service, including, but not limited to, costs incurred for Internet access.
4395.title: You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold the service harmless in case of a claim related to your use of the service

tosdr.case: You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold the service harmless in case of a claim related to your use of the service
tosdr.tldr:
INDEMNITY

You agree to indemnify and hold Discogs, and its subsidiaries, affiliates, officers, agents, co-branders or other partners, and employees, harmless from any alleged claim or demand, including reasonable attorney fees, made by any third party due to or arising out of Your use of the Service, Your connection to the Service, Your violation of the TOS, or Your violation of any rights of another, whether You are a registered user or not. You are solely responsible for Your actions when using the Service, including, but not limited to, costs incurred for Internet access.

4396.quoteText:
You are entirely responsible for any and all activities which occur under Your account if You do not maintain the confidentiality of Your password and account.
Furthermore, You are entirely responsible for any and all activities which occur under Your account by You or someone You authorize to use Your account.
4396.title: You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and for the activities on your account

tosdr.case: You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and for the activities on your account
tosdr.tldr:
The ToS state under the headline "USER ACCOUNT, PASSWORD, AND SECURITY": 
"[...] You are entirely responsible for any and all activities which occur under Your account if You do not maintain the confidentiality of Your password and account. Furthermore, You are entirely responsible for any and all activities which occur under Your account by You or someone You authorize to use Your account. [...]"

4397.quoteText: You may change Your password at any time. You may also set up a new account and close an old one at Your convenience.
4397.title: You have the right to leave this service at any time

tosdr.case: You have the right to leave this service at any time
tosdr.tldr:
The ToS state under "USER ACCOUNT, PASSWORD, AND SECURITY": 
"[...] You may change Your password at any time; You may also set up a new account and close an old one at Your convenience. [...]"

4425.quoteText: (2) not to use the Service for illegal purposes.
4425.title: Users agree not to use the service for illegal purposes

tosdr.case: Users agree not to use the service for illegal purposes
tosdr.tldr:
Discogs' ToS state under "USER CONDUCT":

"You agree: [...] (2) not to use the Service for illegal purposes; (3) not to interfere or disrupt networks connected to the Service; and (4) to comply with all regulations, policies and procedures of networks connected to the Service.

The Service makes use of the Internet to send and receive certain messages; therefore, Your conduct is subject to Internet regulations, policies and procedures. You will not use the Service for chain letters, junk mail, spamming or any use of distribution lists to any person who has not given specific permission to be included in such a process.

You agree not to transmit through the Service any unlawful, harassing, libelous, abusive, threatening, or harmful material of any kind or nature. You further agrees not to transmit any material that encourages conduct that could constitute a criminal offense, give rise to civil liability or otherwise violate any applicable local, state, national or international law or regulation. Attempts to gain unauthorized access to other computer systems are prohibited.

You shall not interfere with another person’s use and enjoyment of the Service or another entity's use and enjoyment of similar services."

4430.quoteText: You grant a non-exclusive, non-revocable, transferable right to Us to use Your user-generated content, unrestricted in time and territory, for the purpose of rendering the Service.</p
4430.title: Users grant Discogs the right to use their content across all their services

tosdr.case: The copyright license that users grant this service is limited to the parties that make up the service's broader platform.
tosdr.tldr: Discogs and its related platforms are based on user content. As such, by using the service, users grant Discogs a non-revocable and transferable right to use their content for as long as they wish, wherever they wish.

4517.quoteText: You will not use the Service for chain letters, junk mail, spamming or any use of distribution lists to any person who has not given specific permission to be included in such a process.
4517.title: This service prohibits users sending chain letters, junk mail, spam or any unsolicited messages

tosdr.case: This service prohibits users sending chain letters, junk mail, spam or any unsolicited messages
tosdr.tldr: The ToS state under "USER CONDUCT": "You will not use the Service for chain letters, junk mail, spamming or any use of distribution lists to any person who has not given specific permission to be included in such a process."

4526.quoteText: Attempts to gain unauthorized access to other computer systems are prohibited.
4526.title: Discogs prohibits users from attempting to gain unauthorized access to other computer systems

tosdr.case: This service prohibits users from attempting to gain unauthorized access to other computer systems
tosdr.tldr: Under "USER CONDUCT", Discogs' ToS state: "Attempts to gain unauthorized access to other computer systems are prohibited."

4527.quoteText: You shall not interfere with another person’s use and enjoyment of the Service or another entity's use and enjoyment of similar services.
4527.title: Discogs users shall not interfere with another person's enjoyment of the service

tosdr.case: Users shall not interfere with another person's enjoyment of the service
tosdr.tldr:
Discogs' ToS state: "You shall not interfere with another person’s use and enjoyment of the Service or another entity's use and enjoyment of similar services."
This statement is kept very vague and could potentially be used as grounds for censorship or account deletion.

DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES

YOU EXPRESSLY UNDERSTAND AND AGREE THAT:

(a) YOUR USE OF THE SERVICE IS AT YOUR SOLE RISK. THE SERVICE ARE PROVIDED ON AN "AS IS" AND "AS AVAILABLE" BASIS. WE EXPRESSLY DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT

tosdr.case: The service is provided 'as is' and to be used at the users' sole risk
tosdr.tldr: Discogs disclaims any express or implied warranties.

4531.quoteText: (ii) THE SERVICE WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, TIMELY, SECURE, OR ERROR-FREE,
4531.title: The service provider makes no warranty regarding uninterrupted, timely, secure or error-free service

tosdr.case: The service provider makes no warranty regarding uninterrupted, timely, secure or error-free service
tosdr.tldr: Under "DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES", Discogs' ToS state that the website will not warrant "UNINTERRUPTED, TIMELY, SECURE, OR ERROR-FREE" service.

4533.title: Discogs does not guarantee that any software errors will be corrected

4535.quoteText: (c) ANY MATERIAL DOWNLOADED OR OTHERWISE OBTAINED THROUGH THE USE OF THE SERVICE IS DONE AT YOUR OWN DISCRETION AND RISK AND THAT YOU WILL BE SOLELY RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY DAMAGE TO YOUR COMPUTER SYSTEM OR LOSS OF DATA OR OTHER LIABILITY THAT RESULTS FROM THE DOWNLOAD OF ANY SUCH MATERIAL.

tosdr.case: Users are responsible for any risks, damages, or losses they may incur by downloading materials
tosdr.tldr: Discogs is not liable for any damages to the users' computer systems that occur as a result of downloading material from Discogs.

4538.quoteText:
The TOS is governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of Oregon, United States of America, without regard to principles of conflicts of laws.
The parties irrevocably and unconditionally submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the State of Oregon with respect to any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with the TOS
4538.title: The court of law governing Discogs' terms is in the State of Oregon, United States of America

tosdr.case: The court of law governing the terms is in location X
tosdr.tldr: Any conflicts regarding Discogs' Terms of Service will be submitted to the courts of the State of Oregon, USA. The Terms will be interpreted according to the laws of Oregon. By using Discogs, users agree to this exclusive jurisdiction.

4539.quoteText: If a court finds any portion of the TOS to be unenforceable or invalid, that portion will be enforced to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law and the remainder of the TOS will remain valid and enforceable.
4539.title: Invalidity of any portion of Discogs' Terms of Service does not entail invalidity of its remainder

tosdr.case: Invalidity of any portion of the Terms of Service does not entail invalidity of its remainder
tosdr.tldr: Should one portion of the ToS be invalid, Discogs will enforce it as much as possible under applicable law. The invalidity of one portion does not affect any other provision of the ToS.
